benchmark_config.jira_title: Implement/Test API: DELETE /1.0/kb/invoicePayments/{paymentId}/customFields - Remove custom fields from payment

covered: Valid Deletion scenarios: TC01 (all fields), TC02 (specific fields), TC03 (with optional headers), TC04 (no fields), TC05 (extra param ignored), TC06 (max fields), TC07 (min fields), TC09/TC10 cover non-existent or missing data paths via error codes handled (400/404), TC11 (missing required header), TC12 (unauthorized), TC13 (malformed field), TC14 (service unavailable), TC15 (large payload), TC16 (partial input with invalid ID), TC17 (header XSS), TC18 (SQL injection attempt in field), TC19 (performance under load), TC20 (regression for removal of all fields), TC21/TC22 (audit log integration), TC23 (backward compatibility with legacy client)
gaps: Pagination: No tests cover pagination handling for large datasets (e.g., listing/deleting fields in pages).
Concurrency: No explicit race-condition scenarios where multiple actors delete or modify fields concurrently.
Soft Deletes: The tests do not clearly confirm whether deletions are soft (flagged) or hard deletes.
Caching/ETag: No tests verify caching headers or any entity tag behavior for DELETE responses.
Rate Limiting: No tests assess system behavior under rapid successive DELETE requests or throttling.
recommendations: Add pagination-focused tests to ensure proper behavior when large numbers of custom fields exist and deletion requests involve paginated parameters.
Introduce concurrency scenarios to validate correct behavior when concurrent delete requests impact the same payment’s custom fields.
Clarify and test soft-delete vs hard-delete semantics if applicable; verify the state and audit trails accordingly.
Add tests that inspect caching headers (ETag, Cache-Control) and idempotence behavior for DELETE operations.
Incorporate rate-limiting/throttling tests to confirm stable behavior under high request volume.
